result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado

defendant.name: Hernandez-Mercado, Rafael A
defendant.address: 10400 West Fond Du Lac Avenue #1, Milwaukee, WI 53224

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado.  Attorney Nate McClure in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduled jury trial.  Parties have negotiated a resolution. On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Milwaukee County Ordinance 63.015 carry concealed weapon.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court found the Defendant guilty. Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of 100.00$ including costs to be paid by 12-05-2022 or civil judgment for failure to pay.

Defendant Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado not in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. 
Court order the Jury Trial to remain on Branch 13's calendar.

Defendant Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado appeared by video means with Attorney.   Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense asks that defendant's appearance be waived, granted. Defense requests a short status to allow time to meet with client. 
Court orders matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rafael A Hernandez-Mercado appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
